info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 6:13AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Menard, western Sangamon, southeastern Cass and eastern Morgan Counties through 645 AM CDT... At 612 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Tallula to 6 miles southwest of Franklin. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Pleasant Plains and Tallula around 620 AM CDT. Athens around 625 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include New Berlin, Loami, Auburn, Williamsville, Springfield and Chatham. This includes the following highways... Interstate 55 near mile marker 92, and between mile markers 103 and 105. Interstate 72 between mile markers 73 and 98. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for central and west central Illinois.
